title: Syracuse police: Man brought loaded gun to Hancock Airport
content: SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- A man was arrested early this morning at Syracuse Hancock International Airport after a loaded gun was found in his bag, police said. Transportation Security Administration officers screening luggage around 5:45 a.m. discovered a loaded .32-caliber handgun in Timothy Bass' carry-on bag after passing the bag through an X-ray machine, said Lt. Eric Carr, of the Syracuse Police Department. Bass, a member of the U.S. Navy, told police he forgot the weapon was in his bag, Carr said. Bass, of Norwich, Connecticut, was traveling to his base in Honolulu, Hawaii. The sailor did not possess a valid permit for the gun, Carr said. Bass was arrested and charged with fourth-degree criminal possession of a weapon, a misdemeanor. He was held in the Onondaga County Justice Center pending arraignment.
